channel.title: A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content on A Hugo website

item.title: Git basics
item.description: Online tutorial for Git Some basic commands Add-commit-push git add -u :/ # adds all modified file changes to the stage; analgus to confirm the changes git add * :/ # adds modified and any new files (that’s not gitignore’ed) to the stage git commit -m ‘your commit comment’ # equivalent to save the file git commit -am ‘your commit comment’ # perform add and commit git push origin master # or just git push origin master Check history git status # consistency status with branch master, changes not staged for commit, untracked file.

item.title: Git basics
item.description: Online tutorial for Git Some basic commands Add-commit-push git add -u :/ # adds all modified file changes to the stage; analgus to confirm the changes git add * :/ # adds modified and any new files (that’s not gitignore’ed) to the stage git commit -m ‘your commit comment’ # equivalent to save the file git commit -am ‘your commit comment’ # perform add and commit git push origin master # or just git push origin master Check history git status # consistency status with branch master, changes not staged for commit, untracked file.

item.title: A brief introduciton on intialization of a website using the R blogdown package
item.description: An useful short video introdution/guide is provided here.The website will be hosted by github webiste and administered using Netfily.com server. Some basic background knowledges may involve: Markdown syntax Github account Git1 Git2 Blogdown Set up a new repository on github The Github.com is where you will upload and store all the static documents for your website. Suppose you have already set up a github account. The creation of a new repository is straightforward, nothing other than inputting some basic repository info.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: About this blog
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
